definition: generalissimo
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
handsome/graceful/smart/commander in chief/(coll.) cool!/sweet!

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen wins an election for China republic military government generalissimo.
sentences.chinese: 孫中山當選爲中華民國軍政府大元帥。

definition: Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
to pacify/to appease/appeasement
Yan Xishan (1883-1960), warlord in Shanxi
to sacrifice one's life

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
to say goodbye/leave-taking/farewells
to die in battle (idiom)
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
general headquarters
